definition: to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
fetus/litter/tire/abbr. of 輪胎|轮胎
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
bone

sentences.english: Decorate to burnish from model lines, had had the change of thoroughly remould oneself.
sentences.chinese: 从造型线条到打磨装饰，已经有了脱胎换骨的变化。

sentences.english: It's like being reborn from the inside out.
sentences.chinese: 它就像是从内到外脱胎换骨一样。

sentences.english: A year after the show was filmed, he is a very different young man.
sentences.chinese: 节目录制一年之后，他完全脱胎换骨。

sentences.english: And I did. Today our whole business is different.
sentences.chinese: 现在我已确实作到，整个公司也仿佛脱胎换骨。

sentences.english: It is no longer hard to continue, as you realise that health foods are making you so much better.
sentences.chinese: 它不再继续努力，你知道你的健康食品正在脱胎换骨。

sentences.english: Theatre will be reinvented and become much freer and more imaginative.
sentences.chinese: 戏剧将脱胎换骨，变得更为自由，更富想象力。

sentences.english: One way or another, Kevin Martin pledges to be unrecognizable.
sentences.chinese: 不成功便成仁，凯文马丁誓言要脱胎换骨。

definition: to transform/to morph/to degenerate/metamorphosis/transmutation/transformation/decay/degeneration
sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
to look completely new (idiom); brand new/changed beyond recognition
to rise from the ashes (idiom)/to thrive again after surviving an ordeal
to be reborn/rebirth
qualitative leap
to advance by leaps and bounds
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
lit. to break through a cocoon and turn into a butterfly (idiom)/fig. to emerge strong after a period of struggle/to get to a better place after going through difficult period
to make a breakthrough
to sublimate/sublimation (physics)/to raise to a higher level/to refine/promotion
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
lit. one day, a thousand miles (idiom); rapid progress
lit. like a tiger that has grown wings/with redoubled power (idiom)
the three energies of Chinese medicine: 精[jing1], 氣|气[qi4], and 神[shen2]
to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery
